channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some Airports Have A New Security Routine: Taking Your Temperature
item.description: With ear probes, infrared cameras and laser beams pointed at your forehead, airports around the world are trying to stop infected passengers before they board a plane.
item.content:encoded:
With ear probes, infrared cameras and laser beams pointed at your forehead, airports around the world are trying to stop infected passengers before they board a plane.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Klibanoff

item.title: Zimbabwean First Lady's Summer Project: A Ph.D. Program
item.description: Robert Mugabe's wife, Grace, has received a doctorate after what appears to be just a few months in the program. This has renewed speculation that she could eventually succeed her 90-year-old husband.
item.content:encoded:
Robert Mugabe's wife, Grace, has received a doctorate after what appears to be just a few months in the program. This has renewed speculation that she could eventually succeed her 90-year-old husband.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Ukrainian President Thanks Congress For Supporting Freedom
item.description: Petro Poroshenko called Russia's annexation of Crimea a "cynical act of treachery." He is in the U.S. meeting with President Obama and others to lobby for increased aid to fight insurgents.
item.content:encoded:
Petro Poroshenko called Russia's annexation of Crimea a "cynical act of treachery." He is in the U.S. meeting with President Obama and others to lobby for increased aid to fight insurgents.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Islamic State Seizes Villages; Australia Says It Foiled Beheading Plot
item.description: The Islamist rebels also known as ISIS or ISIL reportedly captured 16 Kurdish villages in northern Syria in a major push for territory. The move has prompted fears of a massacre of civilians.
item.content:encoded:
The Islamist rebels also known as ISIS or ISIL reportedly captured 16 Kurdish villages in northern Syria in a major push for territory. The move has prompted fears of a massacre of civilians.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Scotland's Historic Decision: Should It Stay Or Should It Go?
item.description: Scots went to the polls to vote in a referendum that will decide whether they remain with the United Kingdom or end a 300-year-old union.
item.content:encoded:
Scots went to the polls to vote in a referendum that will decide whether they remain with the United Kingdom or end a 300-year-old union.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Kerry Briefs Skeptic Senators On Coalition Plans Against ISIS
item.description: President Obama says more than 40 countries are joining together to fight the Islamic State militants. Secretary of State John Kerry has returned from a trip to try to put together a coalition.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama says more than 40 countries are joining together to fight the Islamic State militants. Secretary of State John Kerry has returned from a trip to try to put together a coalition.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Scottish Voters Cast Ballots On Whether To Cut Ties To U.K.
item.description: Voting is underway in Scotland on a referendum that will decide if the country becomes independent. British Prime Minister David Cameron has promised Scotland more autonomy if it stays in the union.
item.content:encoded:
Voting is underway in Scotland on a referendum that will decide if the country becomes independent. British Prime Minister David Cameron has promised Scotland more autonomy if it stays in the union.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Ari Shapiro

item.title: Iranian Official Shares Little About Detained U.S. Reporter
item.description: On July 22, Tehran-based Washington Post correspondent Jason Rezaian was detained by Iranian authorities. Steve Inskeep talks to Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif about the case.
item.content:encoded:
On July 22, Tehran-based Washington Post correspondent Jason Rezaian was detained by Iranian authorities. Steve Inskeep talks to Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif about the case.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Teen Voters Could Sway Outcome Of Scotland's Independence Vote
item.description: Voters go to the polls on Thursday to decide whether to remain part of the United Kingdom. For the first time in U.K. history, 16 and 17 year olds are being allowed to take part in the referendum.
item.content:encoded:
Voters go to the polls on Thursday to decide whether to remain part of the United Kingdom. For the first time in U.K. history, 16 and 17 year olds are being allowed to take part in the referendum.

» E-Mail This

item.title: ISIS Militants Found To Have American-Made Weapons
item.description: Audie Cornish talks to Shawn Harris of Conflict Arms Research about how the Islamic State militants acquire weapons. Harris embedded with Kurdish troops in order to trace weapons from the battlefield.
item.content:encoded:
Audie Cornish talks to Shawn Harris of Conflict Arms Research about how the Islamic State militants acquire weapons. Harris embedded with Kurdish troops in order to trace weapons from the battlefield.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Islamic State Planned Killing In Australia, PM Says After Raids
item.description: Fifteen people were arrested across Sydney in the counterterrorism operation, which one official said was the largest in the country's history.
item.content:encoded:
Fifteen people were arrested across Sydney in the counterterrorism operation, which one official said was the largest in the country's history.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Doctor Says Toronto Mayor Rob Ford Has 'Rare ... Difficult' Cancer
item.description: The mayor, who made international news after he admitted to smoking crack, dropped out of the mayoral race last week. Ford's doctor said he was "optimistic."
item.content:encoded:
The mayor, who made international news after he admitted to smoking crack, dropped out of the mayoral race last week. Ford's doctor said he was "optimistic."

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Here's What Tomorrow's U.K. Newspapers Are Saying About Scotland's Vote
item.description: Scotland votes Thursday on whether to become an independent country. The polls show the two sides are neck and neck. British newspapers, as expected, are leading with the story.
item.content:encoded:
Scotland votes Thursday on whether to become an independent country. The polls show the two sides are neck and neck. British newspapers, as expected, are leading with the story.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Krishnadev Calamur

item.title: House Passes Bill That Authorizes Arming Syrian Rebels
item.description: Even though it was backed by both party leaders, the vote split politicians within their own ranks. The final tally on the narrow military measure was 273 to 156.
item.content:encoded:
Even though it was backed by both party leaders, the vote split politicians within their own ranks. The final tally on the narrow military measure was 273 to 156.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Transcript: Iranian Foreign Minister Zarif's Full NPR Interview
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif about the U.S. approach to combating extremist groups in Iraq and Syria, and the talks on Iran's nuclear weapons program.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif about the U.S. approach to combating extremist groups in Iraq and Syria, and the talks on Iran's nuclear weapons program.
